body_html:
@rogerwwww,

Roger did you just follow from here?:

https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path

Ubuntu+Build from source==>Clone & Build:

  • Clone Caffe2's source code from our Github repository
    git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git && cd pytorch
    git submodule update --init

  • Create a directory to put Caffe2's build files in
    mkdir build && cd build

  • Configure Caffe2's build
    cmake ..

  • Compile, link, and install Caffe2
    sudo make install

I may have confused the issue in my previous comment to @pjh5 where I am asking about cuda 9.0 - cudnn 7.0 v/s cuda 8.0 + cudnn 5.1.

@pjh5 my apologies. Since CUDA 9.0 and cnDNN 7.1.2 is already installed I should just build caffe2 from source.

body:
@rogerwwww,

Roger did you just follow from here?: 

https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path

Ubuntu+Build from source==>Clone & Build:

* Clone Caffe2's source code from our Github repository
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git && cd pytorch
git submodule update --init

* Create a directory to put Caffe2's build files in
mkdir build && cd build

* Configure Caffe2's build
cmake ..

* Compile, link, and install Caffe2
sudo make install

I may have confused the issue in my previous comment to @pjh5 where I am asking about cuda 9.0 - cudnn 7.0 v/s cuda 8.0 + cudnn 5.1.

@pjh5 my apologies. Since CUDA 9.0 and cnDNN 7.1.2 is already installed I should just build caffe2 from source.
